title: Cowardly Remainer MPs can't hide from the people's judgment forever
text:
In a country as divided as ours, we must embrace the few opinions that unite us. One such is that parliament is currently going through a bit of a rough patch in terms of the low esteem in which it is generally held.

This is nothing new from a historical point of view. I write as one who was a member of the Commons during the parliamentary expenses scandal of 2009. In years since then, though, MPs had at least begun to improve their general reputation from "criminal" to merely "untrustworthy". That was until Brexit came along.
